config.question: What gave Jacksonians the edge in the 1828 presidential election?

choices.content: the portrayal of Jackson as an authentic man of the people
the impressive extent of Jackson’s educational qualifications
the immense support that Jackson received from the North
the nationalistic views of his supporters

answer_3.response: What gave Jacksonians the edge was their portrayal of Jackson as an authentic man of the people, despite his wealth in land and slaves. His backwoods upbringing, record as a military hero and Indian fighter, and even lack of education were touted as evidence that he was a true representative of the common people.
